phrases.phrase: Enabling this option will force the add-on to output cache hit status to Server Error Log. You may want to enable this for the first few minutes prior to installing the add-on to see if the cache is being used correctly.
You may customize the prefix of the cache ID with this option. Please keep in mind that you may only enter valid strings. By changing the prefix, the add-on will be forced to ignore old caches.

Set how long to cache share counts of every pages (in seconds). To disable caching, use 0.
NOTE: This requires your XenForo installation to have any back-end caching enabled on config.php!
cURL Option: Use the add-on's certificate bundle

You may manually update the cacert.pem file located in library/EndlessHorizon/SocialShare/cacert.pem with this file whenever you feel like to.
NOTE: If you've had included certificate info in your php.ini, it's recommended to disable this option to avoid conflicts.

Enable this option to tell cURL to check the existence of common name and verify that it matches the hostname provided.
NOTE: For cURL version 7.10 or newer, this option will also tell cURL to verify peer's certificate.

If you don't want to use cURL for whatever reason, then disable it here. After that, the add-on will use file_get_contents function instead. If you want to disable all share counters, then you have to disable all sites from the Enable share counts option above.
NOTE: If you don't have cURL, the add-on will still automatically use file_get_contents function.

Set your preferred body for the email share here.
You may also use these params: {url} for the page's URL and {title} for the page's title.
Hint: You may actually use any available replace methods on eh_socialshare_js template.
Add. Hint: If you want to add new lines, write %0D%0A at the end of every line which will have a new line after them.

Set your preferred subject for the email share here.
You may also use these params: {url} for the page's URL and {title} for the page's title.
Hint: You may actually use any available replace methods on eh_socialshare_js template.

If you haven't added Font Awesome by your own, you can use this add-on to enable it (don't forget to fill Font Awesome CSS path option below).
NOTE: This add-on will only add the Font Awesome on pages that have the share page widget.

Enabling this option will make the add-on output debug messages when fetching share count from any social sites into your Server Error Logs. If some social sites have never returned share count to your server, you may want to know why by enabling this option. Other than that, this will be used for development only.
Path to the main CSS of Font Awesome. This can be a relative or a fixed path.
Enabling this option will make the add-on output debug messages into your and your visitor's browser console.

A fixed path to a JPG, PNG or GIF image that will be used as pin for Pinterest share.
Note: Do not use a relative path. Pinterest will try to fetch the image remotely, so it will need direct access to the image. Thus it will also fail if you have an anti hotlinking service enabled.
Add. Hint: Leaving this option blank will tell the add-on to use the image you specified for Open Graph whenever available.

(Optional) Choose sites which you want their share counts to be fetched by the add-on. Please note that even if you have a site disabled in the Enable social sites option, the add-on will still fetch its share count as long as you have it enabled in this option, so you need to disable it here too.
NOTE: Strongly suggested not to enable this feature if your XenForo installation doesn't have any back-end caching enabled. Otherwise there'll be a considerable performance impact, as the server will have to fetch share counts on EVERY page load.
If you want to use Twitter, you must register your site at OpenShareCount.

Choose social sites that you want to enable. Disabling all sites will prevent any necessary JS files to be loaded.
If you want to use LINE, please be aware that the add-on will use an image instead of a Font Awesome icon.

Set how long will the add-on let cURL or file_get_contents run in every tries to fetch share count from social sites (in milliseconds). This strongly depends on your server's latency to the social sites' servers. Servers with lower latency may have this lower, while servers with higher latency must have this higher.
To disable timeout limit, set this option to 0.
If your cURL version is older than version 7.6.12, the add-on will automatically convert the timeout value into seconds, and round the fractions up with ceil function.
Try again if the previous attempt was failed
If the add-on couldn't fetch any share count from any social sites in the previous attempt, tell the add-on to try again in the next attempt (basically in the next page load).
(Optional) A comma-separated list of accounts related to the content of the shared URI.
(Optional) Attribute the source of a Tweet to a Twitter username.

Select where you want the social share page widget to show on pages. The default is on the bottom, but it may not display correctly without extra styling. Which is why for this add-on only, the default is on the top. So if you want to enable it on the bottom, you may need to do some styling customization to make sure it displays correctly.
Select where you want the social share page widget to show on threads list. The default is not to show any.
Select where you want the social share page widget to show on threads. The default is on the bottom, but you can also have it enabled on the top or above the quick reply.

By enabling this option, whenever the add-on can't fetch share count from a particular social site, it will fallback to zero instead of not displaying any count.
NOTE: This will not make Try again if the previous attempt was failed option obsolete.

Floating social share widget.
Made with love by Bobby Wibowo.
